intro: Mocanera, commonly known as the golden trumpet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the genus Mocanera in the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and similar species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Mocanera typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its bark is smooth and often grayish in appearance.
